body: LGTM as well.
I refactored this into a (reusable) class to deal with rangetracking on ordered positions, and the key <-> fraction functionality, as well as adding more tests, documentation, and comments. PTAL.

As it stands now, the temp directory stays after the final results have been moved from it. The temp directory is in the same directory as the output path. Since the Flink test code checks for all files and directories in the output path, and directories not related to the results are regarded as invalid, we have to ignore the temp directory. 

As long as the temp directory stays in the output path, we will have to provide some kind of constant to make tests aware of it. Unless, the directory not being deleted is actually a bug in `FileBasedSink`.

Directory not being deleted is a bug.

However, I would:
1. Send a quick note on the dev mailing list about this (just to inform)
2. Create a Jira to update the impacted IOs and runners.
By the way, a rebase might help for the Jenkins fail.
Another note: IMHO, it's better to have a Jira for that and mention the Jira in the commits message.

R: @tgroh
Build time down to 1:11 with `mvn -T1C clean verify -DskipTests`. Obviously tests make it slower.
LGTM.

Actually, I had some more feedback for tightening up the API, and was working on a pull-request-for-your-pull-request. We've been considering moving non-core transforms to extensions. I'll put something together.

Sorry this didn't get prompt attention, but we really need to stick to waiting for an LGTM comment or GitHub "approval".
I thought this was approved. My mistake.
This is being superseded by [BEAM-725](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-725) with PR #1294
@kennknowles If you are happy with this PR then I would prefer to merge it now and do the follow-up for the master changes when merging master. This would allow me to complete #1213 meanwhile..
LGTM
Jenkins has progressed to the example integration tests, which are not affected by this PR, so I'll take that LGTM and commit.

The other thing I would add is that for very old branches the precommits need to be run.

Specifically, if you're the author: rebase and push so that Jenkins re-runs.

If not, it's trickier -- the merging committer can run the precommit manually (e.g., `mvn clean verify -Prelease`) before merging.

This merge immediately broke the build. I think Kenn has pushed fixes, but we should prevent these build breaks.

OK to merge then. It does look like the changes to the example pom might be held up a bit on testing changes.

LGTM

Probably doesn't merit a full readme file, but a comment in one with a
redirect in the other would be sufficient.

@peihe, thats correct. The user can call GoogleCredentials.fromStream(InputStream) to load any location they want if they want to use custom credential locations. The credentials library supports many more ways to load/create credentials beyond the few that were supported by Dataflow.

To get test signal, I'll have to revise the matchers. Currently there are already pretty common flakes with the only message being a mismatched checksum, but it is likely enough that the new matcher needs fix-ups. While I'm at it, I might as well improve the extant matcher so it can give a hint about what is wrong.

Re:

> I manually checked via mvn findbugs:check. This is not currently activated in the pre-commit hook, is it?

It is enabled in Jenkins by default, and in `release` profile. See comments on https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1295

Cool! I'll review in the next couple of days if that's OK as I'm a bit busy..

This PR creates a separate `SparkContextOptions` that inherits `SparkPipelineOptions` and handles `ProvidedSparkContext` and `Listeners`.
This new `SparkContextOptions` is NOT registered via `SparkRunnerRegistrar` to avoid the issues mentioned in [BEAM-944](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-944).

Yup -- I believe this would solve the issue mentioned in BEAM-944. LGTM.
